alert.note: Alert for Williams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 9:17PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Steuben, northeastern De Kalb and southwestern Williams Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 916 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Waterloo, or 7 miles north of Auburn, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy downpours will also occur with this storm. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hamilton around 920 PM EDT. Auburn and Waterloo around 925 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Butler. This includes Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 333 and 348. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
